{{Infobox organization | name = The Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia | logo = | motto = Making justice real | type = [[Non-profit organization|Non-profit]] | founded = 1932 | location = [[Washington, D.C.]], [[United States|U.S.]] | key_people = Eric Angel | fields = Legal services to the indigent | services = Legal representation, class action litigation | num_members = | homepage = {{URL|http://www.legalaiddc.org/|legalaiddc.org/}} }} The '''Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia''' is the oldest and largest [[Legal aid in the United States#Civil legal aid|civil legal aid]] organization in [[Washington, D.C.]].
Created in 1932, the Legal Aid Society provides representation and legal services to indigent residents of the District of Columbia in areas like domestic violence (including [[restraining orders]]), housing, public benefits, and consumer law.<ref>[http://www.legalaiddc.org/who-we-are/ Who We Are], Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia</ref> During the [[Great Recession in the United States|recession of 2008 to 2009]], the Legal Aid Society managed to expand legal services even as gifts from lawyers and law firms declined 15 to 20 percent.<ref>{{cite news | first = Susan |last = Kinzie |title = 5 Nonprofit-Group Leaders Honored for Hard Work in Downturn |date = October 5, 2009 |work = Washington Post |url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/wp-dyn/content/article/2009/10/04/AR2009100402741.html}}</ref> In 2014, it provided legal services to approximately 8,800 indigent Washingtonians.<ref>[https://www.cfp-dc.org/cfpdc/nonprofit-detail.php?urllocal2014=1365/Legal-Aid-Society-of-the-District-of-Columbia Legal Aid Society of the District of Columbia], Catalogue for Philanthropy</ref> In 2017, it filed a lawsuit in federal court alleging widespread problems with the District’s food stamp program.<ref>{{cite news |last = Marimow |first = Ann E. |title = Lawsuit alleges widespread problems in District-run food stamp program |work = Washington Post |date = August 28, 2017 |url = https://www.washingtonpost.com/local/public-safety/widespread-problems-in-district-run-food-stamp-program-alleged-in-new-lawsuit/2017/08/28/d4cb6c9c-8bf5-11e7-84c0-02cc069f2c37_story.html}}</ref>

'''Limestone Calcined Clay Cement''' (LC<sup>3</sup>) is a [[low-carbon]] [[cement]]<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jenniferhicks/2014/06/23/green-cement-to-help-reduce-carbon-emissions/#543ecb255b93|title=Green Cement To Help Reduce Carbon Emissions|work=Forbes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orangenews9.com/indo-swiss-proj-in-low-carbon-cement-to-get-boost/|title=Indo-Swiss proj in low-carbon cement to get boost|work=Orange News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sourceable.net/green-cement-reduces-carbon-footprint-by-40/|title=Green Cement Reduces Carbon Footprint by 40%|work=Sourceable}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://precast.org/2015/11/green-cement/|title=Green Cement|work=Precast}}</ref> developed by the [[École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne]], IIT-Delhi, IIT-Bombay, Technology and Action for Rural Development (TARA), IIT-Madras, and the Central University of Las Villas ([[Cuba]]).<ref>{{cite book|url=https://books.google.com/books?id=vOv5CQAAQBAJ&pg=PA57&lpg=PA57&dq=green+cement+lc3&source=bl&ots=L17asb9ICo&sig=ogj3-Rl7z-_xH55O7_yq7teEwkQ&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwiz0NbQmM_MAhVB1hQKHZ8TB3YQ6AEIQzAG#v=onepage&q=green%20cement%20lc3&f=false|title=Green Building with Concrete: Sustainable Design and Construction, Second Edition|last=Sabnis|first=Gajanan M.|date=2015|publisher=CRC Press|isbn=1498704115|page=57}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.aggbusiness.com/sections/general/news/epfl-plans-new-building-material-for-us1-trillion-development-plan/|title=EPFL plans new building material for US$1 trillion development plan|work=AGG Business}}</ref><ref name="The Hindu">{{cite web|url=http://www.thehindu.com/business/Industry/indoswiss-collaboration-makes-lc3-cement-less-energy-intensive/article6453109.ece|title=Making cement less energy intensive|work=The Hindu}}</ref> The cement can reduce [[carbon dioxide]] emissions ([[CO2]]) related to manufacturing by 30% as compared to ordinary [[portland cement]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.environmentalleader.com/2014/06/25/researchers-test-low-carbon-cement/|title=Researchers Test Low-Carbon Cement|work=Environmental Leader}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sourceable.net/green-cement-reduces-carbon-footprint-by-40/#|title=Green Cement Reduces Carbon Footprint by 40%|work=Sourceable}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/eco-news/cement-which-reduces-co2-emission-developed_1474506.html|title=Cement which reduces CO2 emission developed|work=Z News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newindianexpress.com/cities/chennai/2014/07/17/IITs-Team-up-to-Develop-Eco-friendly-Cement/article2333706.ece|title=IITs Team up to Develop Eco-friendly Cement|work=The New Indian Express}}</ref> In 2014, the LC3 project received 4m CHF in [[Research and Development]] funding from the [[Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation]] (SDC).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://actu.epfl.ch/news/a-new-greener-cement-to-meet-future-demand/|title=A new, greener cement to meet future demand|work=News Mediacom}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2015-09-20/news/66730974_1_global-cement-market-rural-development-demand|title=Indo-Swiss project in low-carbon cement to get boost in India|work=Economic Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.greentechlead.com/news/green-cement-that-reduce-carbon-footprint-by-40-17360|title=Green cement that reduce carbon footprint by 40%|work=Green Tech Lead}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tdg.ch/dossiers/geneve/epfl-developpe-ciment-ecologique/story/26517929|title=L'EPFL développe un ciment écologique|work=Tribune de Geneve}}</ref>
== History ==
Limestone Calcined Clay Cement (LC3) stems from research by the [[Ecole Polytechnique de Lausanne]]. It is the result of an ongoing cooperation between [[EPFL]] and partners in [[India]] and [[Cuba]] on developing low carbon and resource efficient raw materials for [[cement]] manufacturing.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://realty.economictimes.indiatimes.com/news/allied-industries/indo-swiss-project-in-low-carbon-cement-to-get-boost-in-india/49039334|title=Indo-Swiss project in low-carbon cement to get boost in India|work=ET Realty}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newmaterials.com/News_Detail_Limestone_calcined_clay_cement_lc3_to_cut_co2_emissions_by_up_to_30_13413.asp#axzz3E20BN9si|title=Limestone Calcined Clay Cement (LC3) to cut CO2 emissions by up to 30%|work=New Materials International}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.bi-constructionnews.com/en_article_New_Cement_Blend_to_cut_CO2_Emissions_by_up_to_30_.news|title=New Cement Blend to cut CO2 Emissions by up to 30%|work=Construction news}}</ref><ref name="The Hindu" /> In 2014, the [[Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation]] provided CHF 4 million in funding for the [[research and development]] of LC3.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://lenews.ch/2014/06/18/epfls-cement-discovery/|title=EPFL’s cement discovery|work=Le News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/Three-IITs-develop-cement-low-on-carbon-content/articleshow/43763848.cms|title=Three IITs develop cement low on carbon content|work=Times of India}}</ref> Testing and [[standardisation]]<ref name="The Hindu" /> was carried out by the [[École Polytechnique Fédérale de Lausanne]], IIT-Delhi, IIT-Bombay, Technology and Action for Rural Development (TARA), IIT-Madras, and the Central University of Las Villas (Cuba).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/india/India-Switzerland-join-hands-to-reduce-energy-consumption/articleshow/43224425.cms|title=India, Switzerland join hands to reduce energy consumption|work=Times of India}}</ref> Part of the research focused on specific thematic areas of cement research including [[hydrate]] assemblages, pore structure, [[rheology]], [[reactivity (chemistry)]], durability and mechanical properties, production, [[environmental sustainability]], and cost effectiveness.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.globaleventslist.elsevier.com/events/2017/12/international-conference-on-calcined-clays-for-sustainable-concrete/|title=International Conference on Calcined Clays for Sustainable Concrete|work=Global Events}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://sourceable.net/green-cement-reduces-carbon-footprint-by-40/#|title=Green Cement Reduces Carbon Footprint by 40%|work=Sourceable}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.swissnexindia.org/about/yosi/india-and-switzerland-as-innovation-partners/|title=India and Switzerland as Innovation Partners|work=SwissNex}}</ref>
== Composition ==
The main components of LC3 are [[clinker (cement)|clinker]], [[calcined]] [[clay]], [[limestone]], and [[gypsum]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.ecoconstruction-india.com/interviews/dr-soumen-maity--development-alternatives-da|title=LC3|work=eConstruction}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bluewin.ch/fr/infos/suisse/2014/6/17/l-epfl-met-au-point-un-ciment-moins-polluant-.html|title=Ecologie: un ciment moins polluant développé en Suisse|work=Bluewin}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.newmaterials.com/News_Detail_Limestone_calcined_clay_cement_lc3_to_cut_co2_emissions_by_up_to_30_13413.asp#axzz47xX0QJKY|title=Limestone Calcined Clay Cement (LC3) to cut CO2 emissions by up to 30%|work=New Materials}}</ref> Its manufacturing process involves [[synergetic]] [[Mineral hydration|hydration]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://zeenews.india.com/news/eco-news/cement-which-reduces-co2-emission-developed_1474506.html|title=Cement which reduces CO2 emission developed|work=Z News}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.enerzine.com/1037/17360+un-nouveau-ciment-ecologique-pour-repondre-aux-besoins-futurs+.html|title=Un nouveau ciment écologique pour répondre aux besoins futurs|work=Enerzine}}</ref> Adding large amounts of calcined clay and ground limestone to concrete mixtures,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/jenniferhicks/2014/06/23/green-cement-to-help-reduce-carbon-emissions/#22a1049a5b93|title=Green Cement To Help Reduce Carbon Emissions|work=Forbes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.landscapeonline.com/research/article/19390 |title=Clay and Limestone Cement Could Cut Carbon Emissions |work=Landscape Online |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160624041105/http://www.landscapeonline.com/research/article/19390 |archivedate=2016-06-24 |df= }}</ref> the [[aluminates]] from the clay interact with the [[calcium carbonate]]s from the [[limestone]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.worldcement.com/publications/preview/WorldCement/WorldCement-April-2016-Preview.pdf|title=April 2016 Edition|work=World Cement}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://amerika21.de/2015/10/133892/kuba-zement-produktion|title=Kuba produziert Öko-Zement für den Weltmarkt|work=Amerika21}}</ref> The additional [[alumina]] in the [[metakaolin]] reacts with the ground [[limestone]], leading to a less porous material than other cements and providing equal strength with higher levels of [[clinker (cement)|clinker]] substitution.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.researchgate.net/publication/277648554_Effect_of_fineness_in_clinker-calcined_clays-limestone_cements|title=Effect of fineness in clinker-calcined clays-limestone cements|work=Research Gate}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://articles.economictimes.indiatimes.com/2015-09-20/news/66730974_1_global-cement-market-rural-development-demand|title=Indo-Swiss project in low-carbon cement to get boost in India|work=Economic Times}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.orangenews9.com/indo-swiss-proj-in-low-carbon-cement-to-get-boost/|title=Indo-Swiss proj in low-carbon cement to get boost|work=Orange News}}</ref>
== Environmental impact ==
Limestone Calcined Clay Cement is a [[low-carbon]] alternative to the standard [[Portland cement]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.schweizerbauer.ch/vermischtes/allerlei/oeko-zement-erzeugt-40-prozent-weniger-klimagase-16537.html|title=Öko-Zement erzeugt 40 Prozent weniger Klimagase|work=Schweizerbauer}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tdg.ch/dossiers/geneve/epfl-developpe-ciment-ecologique/story/26517929|title=L'EPFL développe un ciment écologique|work=Tribune de Geneve}}</ref> LC3 can reduce [[CO2]] emissions related to cement manufacturing of cement by reducing the amount of [[clinker (cement)|clinker]], replacing it with [[limestone]] and [[calcined]] [[clay]]s.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theconcreteproducer.com/concrete/advancements-in-stronger-greener-concrete_o.aspx|title=Advancements In Stronger, Greener Concrete|work=The Concrete Producer}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.eldestapeweb.com/que-es-el-cemento-ecologico-n11039|title=¿Qué es el cemento ecológico?|work=El Destape}}</ref> Low-grade kaoline [[clay]]s can be used for the production of LC3 and are abundantly available in many parts of the world.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chennai/IITs-working-on-new-cement-blend-to-cut-down-carbon-footprint/articleshow/38447040.cms|title=IITs working on new cement blend to cut down carbon footprint|work=Times of India}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://economictimes.indiatimes.com/environment/global-warming/switzerland-to-help-india-cut-down-greenhouse-emissions/articleshow/43278317.cms|title=Switzerland to help India cut down greenhouse emissions|work=Economic Times}}</ref>

===Wartime impostors and spies===
Many women in history have presented themselves as men in order to advance in typically male-dominated fields. There are many documented cases of this in the military during the American Civil War.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Shearer|first1=Lee|title=Brothers in arms?: Civil War reality predates transgender debate|url=http://www.onlineathens.com/news/20180414/brothers-in-arms-civil-war-reality-predates-transgender-debate|website=Athens Banner-Herald|accessdate=18 April 2018|date=14 April 2018}}</ref> However their purpose was rarely for fraudulent gain. They are listed in the [[List of wartime cross-dressers]].
Spies have often pretended to be people other than they were. One of the famous was [[Chevalier d'Eon]] (1728–1810), a French diplomat who successfully infiltrated the court of Empress Elizabeth of Russia by presenting as a woman.

===Others=== * [[Bampfylde Moore Carew]] (1693–1759), a [[Devon]]shire man whose popular ''Life and Adventures'' included [[picaresque]] episodes of [[Vagabond (person)|vagabond]] life, including his claim to have been elected King of the Beggars. * [[Alan Conway]] (1934–1998), who impersonated [[Stanley Kubrick]] during the early 1990s. * [[Kaspar Hauser]] (1812-1833) German youth who claimed to have grown up in the total isolation of a darkened cell * [[Robert Hendy-Freegard]] (b. 1971), English barman, car salesman and conman who masqueraded as a [[MI5]] agent.<ref>{{cite news|title='MI5' conman wins sentence appeal|url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/england/nottinghamshire/6591627.stm|work=BBC|date=25 April 2007}}</ref> * [[Alicia Esteve Head]] (b. 1973), Spanish woman who claimed to be a survivor of the [[September 11 attacks]], under the name Tania Head.<ref name="NPR Staff">{{cite web|url=https://www.npr.org/2012/04/14/149399210/the-amazing-untrue-story-of-a-sept-11-survivor|title=The Amazing, Untrue Story Of A Sept. 11 Survivor|author=NPR Staff|date=March 26, 2012|publisher=NPR.org}}</ref><ref name="NYT927">{{cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2007/09/27/nyregion/27survivor.html?ei=5087&em=&en=620a38f8cc36fbd0&ex=1191038400&pagewanted=all|title=In a 9/11 Survival Tale, the Pieces Just Don't Fit|author=David W. Dunlap and Serge F. Kovalevski|date=September 27, 2007|newspaper=[[The New York Times]]| quote=Tania Head's story, as shared over the years with reporters, students, friends and hundreds of visitors to ground zero, was a remarkable account of both life and death. | accessdate=September 27, 2007}}</ref> * [[Paul Jordan-Smith]] (1885–1971), father of the hoax art movement called [[Disumbrationism]]. * [[Enric Marco]] (born 1921), Spaniard who claimed to have been a prisoner in the Nazi German concentration camps Mauthausen and Flossenburg in World War II.<ref name="news.bbc">{{cite web | url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/4539461.stm | title=Spanish Nazi camp 'survivor' lied | publisher=[[BBC]] | work=A leading representative of Holocaust survivors in Spain has admitted to being "an impostor" | date=12 May 2005 |}}</ref> * [[Stephen Rannazzisi]] (b. 1978), American actor and comedian who claimed to be a survivor of the September 11 attacks.<ref name=nyt>{{cite news| url =https://www.nytimes.com/2015/09/17/arts/television/steve-rannazzisi-comedian-who-told-of-9-11-escape-admits-he-lied.html |title=Steve Rannazzisi, Comedian Who Told of 9/11 Escape, Admits He Lied| first= Serge F. | last =Kovaleski| date= September 16, 2015| accessdate= September 16, 2015|work =[[The New York Times]]}}</ref> * [[Steven Jay Russell]] (b. 1957), who has impersonated judges and a doctor, among others, and is known for escaping from prison multiple times.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Day|first1=Elizabeth|title=I love you Phillip Morris: a conman's story|url=https://www.theguardian.com/film/2009/sep/06/steven-russell-elizabeth-day-jim-carrey|work=the Guardian|date=5 September 2009}}</ref> * [[Arnaud du Tilh]] (1524–1560), who took the place of [[Martin Guerre]] in the mid-16th century and lived with Guerre's wife and son for three years before being discovered when Guerre returned. * [[Binjamin Wilkomirski]] (born Bruno Grosjean in 1941), who adopted a constructed identity as a [[The Holocaust|Holocaust]] survivor and published author.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Lapppin|first1=Elana|title=The Boy Who had Two Lives|url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/the-boy-who-had-two-lives-1098540.html|work=The Independent|date=6 June 1999}}</ref>
==In fiction==
===Books=== * ''[[Blandings Castle and Elsewhere]]'', 20th-century series by [[P. G. Wodehouse]], featuring impersonations, and the resulting confusion as a common theme in the fictional [[Blandings Castle]] * ''[[The Count of Monte Cristo]]'', 1844 adventure novel by French author [[Alexandre Dumas]] * ''[[Man in the Iron Mask]]'' (d. 1703), name given to a prisoner arrested as Eustache Dauger in 1669 or 1670, and the subject of many books. * ''[[The Prince and the Pauper]]'' 1881 Mark Twain novel tells the story of two young boys who are identical in appearance * ''[[The Prisoner of Zenda]]'' 1894 adventure novel by British author [[Anthony Hope]].
===Film=== * ''[[The Associate]]'', 1996 film starring [[Whoopi Goldberg]] who disguises herself as a white man to get a job on [[Wall Street]] *''[[Accepted]]'', 2006 American comedy film where a high school slacker and his friends fool their parents into believing their college was real *''[[Aladdin (1992 Disney film)|Aladdin]]'', 1992 American animated comedy musical romantic fantasy adventure film about a street urchin who finds a magic lamp containing a genie who helps him pretend to be a wealthy prince to marry and fall in love with the sultan's daughter in order to hide the lamp from the grand vizer * ''[[Big Momma's House]]'', 2000 American crime comedy film where [[Martin Lawrence]] disguises himself as a rotund grandmother * ''[[Catch Me If You Can]]'', 2002 American biographical crime drama film based on the life of [[Frank Abagnale]], who successfully conned millions of dollars worth of checks as a Pan Am pilot, doctor, and legal prosecutor *''[[Can't Buy Me Love (film)|Can't Buy Me Love]]'', 1987 American teen romantic comedy starring [[Patrick Dempsey]] and [[Amanda Peterson]] about a nerd at a high school in Tucson, Arizona who gives a cheerleader $1,000 to pretend to be his girlfriend for a month to be more popular *''[[Camp Nowhere]]'', 1994 American comedy film starring [[Christopher Lloyd]] as an ex-drama teacher who pretends to be a camp counselor to help kids fake their own summer camp to dupe their parents *''[[Critical Condition (film)|Critical Condition]]'', 1987 American medical comedy film starring [[Richard Pryor]] as a con man who pretends to be a doctor to escape from custody from the authorities *''[[Class Act]]'', 1992 American comedy film starring hip-hop duo [[Kid 'n Play]] as two teenagers, one an intelligent nerd the other a juvenile delinquent who assume the identities of each other when there's a school mix-up with their school records * [[Changeling (film)|''Changeling'']], 2008 American drama film, based partly on real-life events – the Gordon Stewart Northcott case in the 1928 "[[Wineville Chicken Coop Murders]]" * ''[[Coming to America]]'', 1988 American romantic comedy film starring [[Eddie Murphy]] as a rich African prince who pretends to be poor in the hope of finding a wife * ''[[Connie and Carla]]'', 2004 American comedy film where two women pose as [[drag queen]]s * [[Dave (film)|''Dave'']], 1993 comedy-drama film starring [[Kevin Kline]] who has a side job impersonating the President *''[[Don't Tell Her It's Me]]'', 1990 comedy film starring [[Steve Guttenberg]] as an overweight cartoonist who poses as a biker from New Zealand * '' [[Don't Tell Mom The Babysitter's Dead]]'', 1991 American comedy film starring [[Christina Applegate]] as a 17-year-old high school graduate who pretends to be an adult when the babysitter dies of a sudden coronary to prevent her mother from returning home on time * ''[[Face/Off]]'', 1997 American science fiction action thriller film starring [[John Travolta]] and [[Nicolas Cage]], who assume the physical appearances of each other *''[[Genius (1999 film)|Genius]]'', 1999 Disney Channel Original Movie where a 13-year-old whiz kid takes on a bad boy image to make friends his own age * ''[[Houseguest]]'', 1995 comedy film starring [[Sinbad (comedian)|Sinbad]] who pretends to be a rich dentist * ''[[The Hand That Rocks the Cradle (film)|The Hand That Rocks the Cradle]],'' 1992 American psychological thriller film where a vengeful,psychopathic woman pretends to be a nanny to destroy a woman and steal her family * ''[[I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry]]'', 2007 American comedy film where two straight firefighters pose as gay lovers * [[Impostor (film)|''Impostor'']], 2001 American science fiction film based upon the 1953 short story of the same name by [[Philip K. Dick]] * [[The Imposter (2012 film)|''The Imposter'']], 2012 British-American documentary film about the 1997 case of the French confidence trickster [[Frédéric Bourdin]] * ''[[Just One of the Guys]]'', 1985 comedy film about a female high school reporter who poses as a teen-aged boy *''[[Just One of the Girls]]'', 1993 comedy film starring [[Corey Haim]] as a bullied teenage boy who disguises himself as a girl to escape the high school's bully * ''[[Juwanna Mann]]'', 2002 American sports romantic comedy film about a basketball star becoming a female impersonator joining women's basketball, after being banned from men's basketball * ''[[A Knight's Tale]]'', 2001 medieval adventure film featuring a peasant who poses as nobility to compete in a jousting tournament * [[Little Man (2006 film)|''Little Man'']], 2006 American comedy film about a diminutive, but adult, criminal pretending to be an infant *''[[Little Sister (1992 film)|Little Sister]]'', 1992 American comedy film about a college freshman who poses as a woman as a fraternity prank to be pledged into a sorority *''[[Ladybugs (film)|Ladybugs]]'', 1992 American sports comedy film starring [[Rodney Dangerfield]] as a girls' soccer team coach who gets his future stepson to pose as a girl to put him on his team * ''[[Leap of Faith (film)|Leap of Faith]]'', 1992 American comedy-drama film starring [[Steve Martin]] as a con man who pretends to be a traveling evangelist * ''[[Mrs. Doubtfire]]'', 1993 American comedy film starring [[Robin Williams]] who disguises himself as a pleasant, elderly British nanny *''[[Motocrossed]]'', 2001 Disney Channel Original Movie about a young girl who secretly poses as her twin brother to win the big motocross race for him after he is injured *''[[Moon over Parador]]'', 1988 American romantic comedy film starring [[Richard Dreyfuss]] as a film actor who impersonates the dictator of Parador after he dies of a heart attack * ''[[The New Guy]]'', 2002 American teen comedy film about a high school geek who poses as a dangerous criminal to be more popular *''[[Nuns on the Run]]'', 1990 British comedy film starring [[Eric Idle]] and [[Robbie Coltrane]] as criminals posing as [[nun]]s to hide from a rival gang *''[[Nobody's Perfect (1990 film)|Nobody's Perfect]]'', 1990 American comedy film starring [[Chad Lowe]] as a college freshman who poses as a girl to join the women's tennis team in order to be closer to the girl he likes after getting kicked off his college's tennis team * [[Overboard (1987 film)|''Overboard'']], 1987 American romantic comedy film about a poor carpenter who tricks a rich, [[amnesia]]c heiress into believing that he is her husband; [[Overboard (2018 film)|remade in 2018]] with the gender roles reversed * ''[[The Parent Trap (1961 film)|The Parent Trap]]'', 1961 American comedy film about long-lost identical twin sisters who meet at summer camp, then switch identities in order that each one could meet the parent that she never knew; [[The Parent Trap (1998 film)|remade in 1998]]
* [[The Ringer (2005 film)|''The Ringer'']], 2005 comedy film starring [[Johnny Knoxville]] who pretends to be mentally challenged to enter the Special Olympics * [[The Secret of My Success (1987 film)|''The Secret of My Success'']], 1987 American comedy film starring [[Michael J. Fox]] as a kid from the mail room pretends to be an executive * ''[[She's the Man]]'', 2006 American romantic comedy film where a female soccer star pretends to be a boy to play on their team * ''[[Sister Act]]'', 1992 American comedy film starring [[Whoopi Goldberg]] as a Reno lounge singer who pretends to be a nun to avoid the mob * ''[[Some Like It Hot]]'', 1959 American comedy film starring [[Marilyn Monroe]], [[Tony Curtis]] and [[Jack Lemmon]], where two men disguise themselves as female band members after accidentally witnessing the [[Saint Valentine's Day Massacre]] * [[Soul Man (film)|''Soul Man'']], 1986 comedy film about a man who undergoes racial transformation with pills to qualify for a black-only scholarship at [[Harvard Law School]] * ''[[Sorority Boys]]'', 2002 American comedy film where three college boys disguise themselves as women to prove their innocence for a crime they did not commit * ''[[Tootsie]]'', 1982 American comedy-drama film starring [[Dustin Hoffman]] as a struggling actor who pretends to be a woman in order to get a job * ''[[True Identity]]'', 1991 American comedy film starring [[Lenny Henry]] as a black man who disguises himself as a * ''[[Victor Victoria]]'', 1982 film starring [[Julie Andrews]] as a woman who poses as a female impersonator * [[While You Were Sleeping (film)|''While You Were Sleeping'']], 1995 romantic comedy film starring [[Sandra Bullock]] about a subway fare collector who fools a family into believing she was engaged to their comatose son * ''[[White Chicks]]'', 2004 American buddy cop comedy film about two African American FBI agents who disguise themselves as two Caucasian women * ''[[Working Girl]]'', 1988 romantic comedy-drama film starring [[Melanie Griffith]] who plays a secretary who takes on the role of her boss, a player on Wall Street *''[[Wedding Crashers]]'', 2005 American comedy film starring [[Owen Wilson]] and [[Vince Vaughn]] as two party crashers who tricks a wedding party into believing they were invited *''[[The Wedding Date]]'', 2005 American romantic comedy starring [[Debra Messing]] as a single woman who hires a male escort to pose as her boyfriend at her sister's wedding in order to fool her ex-fiancé *''[[Yentl (film)|Yentl]]'', 1983 American romantic musical drama based on the 1975 play of Singer's short story "Yentl the Yeshiva Boy" where [[Barbra Streisand]] as a Jewish girl who disguises herself as a boy to enter religious training * ''[[Zelig]]'', 1983 American mockumentary film by [[Woody Allen]] who plays Leonard Zelig, a nondescript enigma who, out of his desire to fit in and be liked, takes on the characteristics of strong personalities around him

This is a '''list of law schools in Israel'''.
==Law schools in Israel== There are four '''faculties of law''' at these Israeli universities: #[[Bar Ilan University]] (BIU), Yaakov Herzog Faculty of Law, Ramat-Gan #[[University of Haifa]], Faculty of Law, Haifa #[[Hebrew University of Jerusalem]] (HUJI), Faculty of Law, Mount Scopus Campus, Jerusalem #[[Tel Aviv University]] (TAU), Faculty of Law, Tel Aviv
In addition, there are nine '''schools of law''' at these Israeli colleges: #The [[College of Law and Business]] [http://www.clb.ac.il/english/index.html], Ramat Gan #[[The College of Management Academic Studies|College of Management]] [http://lawenglish.colman.ac.il], Rishon Lezion #[[Interdisciplinary Center]] (IDC) [http://portal.idc.ac.il/he/schools/Law/Homepage/Pages/default.aspx], Herzliya #[[Netanya Academic College]] [https://web.archive.org/web/20071026001807/http://law.netanya.ac.il/English/_Articles/Articles.asp?CategoryID=141], Netanya #[[Ono Academic College]], [http://www.ono.ac.il/], Kiryat Ono #[[The Academic Center for Law and Science]], [https://web.archive.org/web/20110721133726/http://www.mishpat.ac.il/main.asp?lngCategoryID=2222], Hod HaSharon #[[Zefat Academic College]], [http://www.zefat.ac.il], Zefat #[[Sapir Academic College]], [https://www.sapir.ac.il/en/about], Sderot #[[Peres Academic College]], [https://www.pac.ac.il/?CategoryID=1019&ArticleID=3639], Rehovot
